article.headline: UC Irvine 74, Loyola Marymount 61
article.story: IRVINE, Calif. (AP)- Patrick Sanders had 12 points with nine rebounds to lead host UC Irvine to a 74-61 victory over Loyola Marymount in a nonconference game Friday at Crawford Court. Sanders scored all of his points in the first half as the Anteaters, of the Big West Conference, made 14 of their first 17 field goals and went to build a 20-point lead with 7:08 left in the first half. Michael Hunter, Adam Rodenberg and Kevin Bland added 14 points each for Irvine (1-0). Chuma Awaji capped a 21-2 run with a layup to give Irvine a 31-11 lead. Irvine led by as many as 24 points, with Loyola Marymount getting no closer than the 13-point final score. Irvines defense forced 21 Loyola Marymount turnovers, led by Brett Lauer, who had five steals. Loyola Marymount, of the West Coast Conference, shot 9-of-24 in the first half. The Lions (0-1) shot 52 percent (13-of-25) in the second half. Shawn Deadwiler scored a game-high 15 points with five rebounds and Marko Deric added 13 points to lead the Lions.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
